data.meta_site_name: Pace - Stancil Funeral Home and Cemetery
data.text: OraLee Berry, age 83, of Coldspring, Texas, passed away Saturday, May 21, 2011. She was born October 1, 1927 in Alicia, Arkansas to parents Arch and Daffiny Golden who preceded her in death along with her husband, Ruben Berry; sons, Michael Ray Berry and Gary Lee Berry; granddaughter, Lisa Berry; and seven brothers and sisters. OraLee was Baptist in faith; a former member of the Ã¢â‚¬Å›Order of Eastern StarÃ¢â‚¬Å¥; she had a love for cooking and gardening along with having a passion for deer hunting and fishing. She was blessed with having a wonderful family and loved spending time with them. She will be greatly missed by all who loved her. Survivors include her daughters, Phyllis Warner and husband, Larry of New Caney, Texas, Bobbie Baker and husband, Paul of Greely, Colorado, Jean Dvorak and husband, Dayton of Houston, Texas; sisters, Joy Watson of Brooksire, Texas, Carolyn Brown of Ashland, Tennessee; five grandchildren, Dwayne Bell, Tanya Nino, Greg Bell, Jennifer Baker, Clifford Baker; fifteen great-grandchildren, Kevin Bell, Jeremy Bell, Joshua Bell, Hunter Bell, Elijah Bell, Lee Anthony Nino, Gabrielle Perry, Viktoria Rinker, Alexandra Bell, Christopher Bell, Tucker Bell, Kylee Sparks, Myles Baker, Caitlyn Cox, Michaela Purdy and one on the way; and one great-great-grandchild, Gabriel Perry; numerous nieces, nephews, cousins, and other cherished family members and faithful friends. Visitation will be held Monday, May 23, 2011, 5:00-9:00 p.m. at Pace-Stancil Funeral Home, Cleveland, Texas. Rev. Greg Smith will preside over funeral services being held Tuesday, May 24, 2011, 2:00 p.m. at Pace-Stancil Chapel, Cleveland, Texas with interment following at Laurel Hill Cemetery, Coldspring, Texas. Pallbearers include Dwayne Bell, Jeremy Bell, Greg Bell, Josh Bell, Clifford Baker, and Kevin Bell; honorary pallbearers include, Lee Anthony Nino, Christopher and Tucker Bell, Hunter and Elijah Bell, Myles Baker, and Alexandra Phyllis Bell.
